meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to polish; to shine; to burnish; to scour; to scrub; to brush (teeth); to grind (e.g. a lens) 弟は銀の食器類を磨いた。My brother polished the silver.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to refine (a skill, etc.); to improve; to hone; to polish (up); to cultivate (one's character) 学生は読書の技能を磨くべきだ。Students should develop their reading skills.
研く 【みがく】、琢く 【みがく】
研く: Rarely-used kanji form. 琢く: Rarely-used kanji form.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to rub; to chafe; to strike (match); to file; to frost (glass) ケリーはマッチを擦ってパイプへもっていった。Kelly struck a match and put it to his pipe.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to lose (e.g. a match); to forfeit; to squander one's money (e.g. through gambling, Pachinko, etc.) ありがね全部すってしまった。We shot our wad.
摩る 【する】、磨る 【する】、擂る 【する】
